22in barrel and pistol grip stock.  It's got the Spiegel drill and tap for scope under the rear sight and on the tang.  I've installed a vintage Redfield peep sight and Marbles dovetail filler.  The stock is inletted with a compass on the top rear of the comb.  It's also checkered and has sling swivels.  I wasn't sure about the originality of the checkering and compass but Mr. Callahan assures me that the sling swivels and D&T are correct for a Spiegel model.  He also says that the compass is likely original as well to "give customers a sense of adventure".  I'm not sure that the checkering is original.  It's just not of the quality you think would leave the Savage factory.  Maybe Spiegel had it done later.  Mr. Callahan's letter didn't specify.  Overall condition is very good for an 80 year old rifle.  No rust or pitting and most of the blue is retained on the receiver.  Even the lever has faint case hardening remaining.  The bore is in great shape.  The stock is in good shape save for some nicks and dings due to handling and age.  There are a couple of small chips on thin edges but nothing real noticable.  It doesn't have the "Savage crack" very common to the 99 at the rear of the tang.  There might be a slight one starting but it may just be a scratch.  This is a very nice, collectable rifle with a factory letter.  You probably won't find another one of these any time soon.  Maybe ever.  I'll include a partial box of Federal ammo that it seems to like.  I'm offering this at a conservative price as I can't verify that the checkering is truly correct.  Otherwise the When I saw the serial number was special, I thought I would try something a little different for this one. I tend to do leafy scroll, which I like very much, but I wanted to simplify the look this time around. This pattern has a very strong central spine with leaves placed more formally at regular intervals. The spine receives very little shading and the leaves are heavily shaded and cross-hatched, which creates a very strong contrast in the design. I think that is what makes it nice. I also removed a fair amount of background from between the scrolls and put in a nice strong punch dot pattern down to increase the contrast.
